010package imagingbook.common.util;
011
012import java.util.Arrays;
013import java.util.Iterator;
014import java.util.PrimitiveIterator;
015
016/**
017 * This class defines static methods for creating array iterators.
018 * 
019 * @author WB
020 * @version 2022/11/20
021 */
022public abstract class ArrayIterator {
023        // TODO: make class generic, consider primitive arrays!
024        private ArrayIterator() {}
025        
026        // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10335662/convert-java-array-to-iterable.
027        /**
028         * Returns an iterator for the specified (non-primitive) array. The resulting iterator does not implement
029         * {@link Iterator#remove()}.
030         *
031         * @param <T> the generic element type
032         * @param array a non-primitive array
033         * @return the associated iterator
034         */
035        public static <T> Iterator<T> from(T[] array) {
036                return Arrays.stream(array).iterator();
037        }
038        
039        // public static void main(String[] args) {
040        //      Integer[] a = {1, 2, 3};
041        //      Iterator<Integer> iterA = ArrayIterator.from(a);
042        //
043        //      while(iterA.hasNext()) {
044        //              System.out.println(iterA.next());
045        //      }
046        //
047        //      int[] b = {5, 6, 7};
048        //      PrimitiveIterator.OfInt iterB = Arrays.stream(b).iterator();
049        //      while(iterB.hasNext()) {
050        //              System.out.println(iterB.next());
051        //      }
052        // }
053
054}
